definition: to drive in reverse/fig. to take a backward step/retrogressive/trying to turn the clock back

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The administration has turned the clock back with its new plans for education.
sentences.chinese: 政府實施新的教育計劃，其實是開倒車。

sentences.english: She backed the car through the gate.
The rollback of reform is already putting off private western investors.
sentences.chinese: 改革開倒車已經讓西方的個體投資商心生疑慮。

sentences.english: He was backed into by a careless driver this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨他被一個粗心大意的駕駛員開倒車時撞着了。

sentences.english: The new regulations will put the clock back by 50 years.
sentences.chinese: 新的規章是開倒車，要退回50年前的水平。
